posts.text:
New paper alert! ğŸš¨

We found that the brain's compass is remarkably stable at two scales

1ï¸âƒ£ the system maintains its internal organization for weeks
2ï¸âƒ£ It "remembers" its orientation for weeks, even after a single visit

This may be key to how the brain aligns its other maps.

Paper: rdcu.be/e3waP

...that said: sort of annoying when a paper pronounces "the brain" but is specifically investigating the mouse brain model. it's likely that human brains do this as well, but that's presumably not a claim their limited experiment equips them to make.

still cool.

posts.text: Excellent demonstration of how lazy "safety engineering" produces inadvertent "lobotomization" in LLMs: I'm invoking a specific formal theory the LLM is aware of, but a system prompt discouraging responses that "wrap identifiable people" interferes with the model's attempts to anchor to theory name.
